alert.note: Alert for Haskell (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 06 at 5:41PM CDT until May 06 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following county, Haskell. * WHEN...Until 730 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 538 PM CDT, strong to severe thunderstorms from just north of Stamford to Haskell were moving northeast at 15 mphDoppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Zero visibility was reported by spotters with this storm in heavy rainfall. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Haskell, Stamford, Paint Creek, Lake Stamford Marina and Irby. - This includes the following Low Water Crossings... Loop Road crossing Paint Creek and County Road 279 crossing North Paint Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
